item.title: Santa Ynez Chumash Donates $25,000 to Central Coast Toys for Tots Campaign
item.description: SANTA YNEZ, CA – December 10, 2025 – The Santa Ynez Band of Chumash Indians recently donated $25,000 to the Central Coast Marine Corps Reserves Toys for Tots campaign, marking the 22nd consecutive year of supporting the nonprofit’s mission to provide holiday gifts to local children in need. The latest donation brings the tribe’s total contributions over the years to $550,000.
item.source:markdown: SANTA YNEZ, CA – December 10, 2025 – The Santa Ynez Band of Chumash Indians recently donated $25,000 to the Central Coast Marine Corps Reserves Toys for Tots campaign, marking the 22nd consecutive year of supporting the nonprofit’s mission to provide holiday gifts to local children in need. item.title: Meet VSFB's 2025 Guardian Arena Teams
item.description: Teams will represent Vandenberg SFB at this year's Guardian Arena competition at Patrick Space Force Base, FL, Dec. 8-9. Guardians and Airmen from Vandenberg Space Force Base prepare to compete in the 3rd Annual Guardian Arena Challenge, held at Patrick Space Force Base, FLA, Dec. 8-9. Vandenberg teams, "Sidetrack'd," "Houston, We Have Two Kevin's (and Clay)," "Flying Tiger," and "CSpoc-alypse," will join 35 teams from across the Space Force to showcase their tactical proficiency, physical fitness, and mental resilience. The event highlights the "Guardian Spirit" in a service-level competition, bringing together participants from Field Commands, Space Base Delta, Space Launch Delta, and Space Delta to vie for the title of the most elite team of Guardians.
item.source:markdown:
Teams will represent Vandenberg SFB at this year's Guardian Arena competition at Patrick Space Force Base, FL, Dec. 8-9.

item.description:

item.title: DAILY MEMO: In Absence of Border Patrol, ICE and HSI Step Up to Take Its Place
item.description:
We're seeing a new strategy taking effect. In the absence of Border Patrol, ICE has stepped up its patrolling, profiling, and stops. This could be due to the news last month that the administration changed out ICE leadership, effectively putting Border Patrol agents in charge of ICE. Today, we saw ICE stopping several vehicles and people on bikes, as well as continuing with their targeted attacks.
